body.p: If you are a citizen of Denmark, Finland, Norway or Iceland you can be granted Swedish citizenship by applying to the County Administrative Board. If you are a citizen of another country you should contact the Swedish Migration Board.
When you submit your application, the conditions listed below must be fulfilled.
Adults can get Swedish citizenship if they

list.p: have become a citizen of Denmark, Finland, Iceland or Norway by any other manner than by submitting an application
have lived in Sweden for the past five years
have not been sentenced to imprisonment or a similar deprivation of liberty sentence during the past five years.

body.p: Youths can get Swedish citizenship if they

list.p: are aged 18 or older but younger than 20
have lived in Sweden continuously since they were 13

body.p: Guardians can submit an application for Swedish citizenship for children who

list.p: have lived in Sweden for the past five years
consent to having a Swedish citizenship, if they have turned 12 and hold a foreign citizenship.

body.p: If the child's guardian has submitted an application for Swedish citizenship, their unmarried children under 18 years of age are included automatically. Children can also be included, if the submitted application only applies to one guardian, provided that he or she

list.p: has sole custody of the child or
has joint custody and the other guardian is already a Swedish citizen.

body.p: If for some reason you have forfeited your Swedish citizenship, you can in certain cases regain your citizenship by applying to the County Administrative Board.
Finnish and Icelandic citizens retain their Finnish or Icelandic citizenship when they become Swedish citizens. Note that this does not apply to nationals of other countries.
